comments: Also where x^(x^(-2)) is a maximum. - _Robert G. Wilson v_, Oct 22 2014
links: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000
formula: sqrt(e) = Sum_{n>=0} 1/(2^n*n!) = Sum_{n>=0} 1/(2n)!!. - _Daniel Forgues_, Apr 17 2011sqrt(e) = 1 + Sum_{n>0} Product_{i=1..n} 1/(2n). - _Ralf Stephan_, Sep 11 2013Continued fraction representation: sqrt(e) = 1 + 1/(1 + 2/(3 + 4/(5 + ... ))). See A000354 for details. - _Peter Bala_, Jan 30 2015
prog: (PARI) { default(realprecision, 20080); x=sqrt(exp(1)); for (n=1, 20000, d=floor(x); x=(x-d)*10; write("b019774.txt", n, " ", d)); } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, May 01 2009
crossrefs: Cf. A058281 for continued fraction for sqrt(e).
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
